# Draft:Breaking Hell

Breaking Hell is a funeral ritual in Taoism that is widely practiced in Guangdong and Hong Kong. As its name implies, this ritual involves opening the gates of hell and releasing the deceased who are trapped within. The ritual is typically performed during the wake, following the chanting and preceding the procession of the ten kings of hell.
Ritual
The tradition in Hong Kong is taoist priests put paper sycees that stained with raw oil and paper that wrote ancestor’s name on the floor of the mourning hall. And surrounded them by nine tiles. Then burn the paper sycees and the paper.
